input_text:
Job Title: Marketing Specialist

Location: Wisconsin, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
Interested in working with one of the markets leading manufacturers? Greenheck Group is a leading growth-focused, environmentally conscious, commercial HVAC manufacturer. Join our team which proudly designs and manufactures the most comprehensive line of ventilation products in the industry. The Greenheck Group is a dynamic multi- branded international organization. Our equipment is used worldwide in commercial, institutional, and industrial facilities, ranging from comfort ventilation to manufacturing processes. Our efficient products improve comfort, safety, and health of lives across the planet. Since 1947, we are deeply committed to helping you “Build Your Future,” through professional growth, challenging leadership roles, and exciting opportunities around the world.

Your Opportunity

As a Marketing Specialist for the Greenheck Group you will be responsible for assisting with the coordination, development, and execution of marketing plans for our product lines. As a member of the corporate marketing team, this position will work closely with the divisional marketing managers to understand the critical needs of the Greenheck Group brands, sales channels, customers, and influencers, taking that knowledge to create plans and programs that will drive awareness and market share growth.

What You’ll Be Doing

Assist with development, execution, and refinement of marketing campaigns for assigned projects to build awareness and generate customer engagement. Assist with coordination of brand projects across multiple channels. Facilitate requests for marketing creative assets, logos, and other marketing materials. Assist with the development and review of marketing materials such as sales and product collateral and ensure brand guidelines are met. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop marketing strategies and plans for new and existing products. Assist with content development projects to ensure relevant topics are covered and key messaging is used. This includes, but is not limited to, literature pieces, social media, email campaigns, blog posts, video storyboards, presentations. Assist with writing, proofreading, and editing content. Help maintain forward-looking marketing calendar (weekly, monthly, quarterly) of marketing events, by project, business unit and media channel. 

Some Things We Think You Should Know

Minimal travel is required in this role.Position can be located in WI or MN

What You Should Have

Required 4 Year / Bachelor Degree in marketing, communications or similar discipline. Required 2-4 years of relevant work experience in marketing, public relations, or advertising. Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, with strong attention to detail. Strong prioritization, organization, and project management skills. Ability to effectively communicate with internal product stakeholders and external partners. 

Benefits For You And Your Family

Our benefit packages and salaries are among the best in our industry. Benefits may vary slightly by location, but usually include:

Health insurancePrescription drug benefitsDental insurancePaid vacations and holidays401(k) Retirement savings planOn-site clinic and fitness center (Schofield location)Employee Assistance ProgramFlexible spending accounts for medical or dependent care expensesTuition assistanceEmployee Wellness Program

We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identity, genetic information, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal law.

If you're looking for a place to grow while working with happy, enthusiastic, values-based people, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Marketing Specialist
output_json.summary: A Marketing Specialist role at Greenheck Group.
soft_skills: Strong prioritization, organization, and project management skills
Ability to effectively communicate with internal product stakeholders and external partners

Coordinate brand projects across multiple channels
Facilitate requests for marketing creative assets, logos, and other marketing materials
Develop and review marketing materials such as sales and product collateral
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop marketing strategies and plans
Assist with content development projects including literature pieces, social media, email campaigns, blog posts, video storyboards, presentations
benefits: On-site clinic and fitness center (Schofield location)
Flexible spending accounts for medical or dependent care expenses
output_json.company_information: Greenheck Group is a leading growth-focused, environmentally conscious, commercial HVAC manufacturer.
